node.title: Nurse fined, suspended for three months after forging signature
node.description: The nurse, who has permanent name suppression, is required to tell future employers about her misconduct.

node.title: Slavery-free chocolate won't leave bad taste in your mouth this Easter
node.description: Thousands of New Zealand kids will enjoy Easter egg hunts this weekend without knowing that many of those treats were produced by other children working in the most punishing conditions.

node.title: Over 150 Palestinians injured after Israeli police raid Al-Aqsa mosque
node.description: The Palestinian Foreign Ministry said it "holds Israel fully and directly responsible for this crime and its consequences".

node.title: "Extinct" wildflower rediscovered after 36 years
node.description: "We walked into [the forest] thinking it was going to break our heart," a scientist said, "and instead we ended up falling in love."

node.title: Police seek 18-year-old in connection with Auckland shooting
node.description: An 18-year-old is being sought in connection with an Auckland shooting last month.

node.title: Migrant arrivals at U.S. border soared to 221,000 in March, highest tally since 2000
node.description: he increase in border arrivals comes as the U.S. prepares to wind down the Title 42 pandemic-era rule, which allows authorities to swiftly expel migrants.

node.title: Health officials investigate mysterious increase in severe liver infection among kids
node.description: No deaths have been reported, the WHO said.

node.title: One dead in Dunedin house fire
node.description: Emergency services attended the fire in the suburb of Kensington shortly after 10pm.

node.title: Easter travelers hit with high airfare and staffing shortages
node.description: Domestic air ticket costs have increased 40% since January and are expected to rise another 10% by June.

node.title: Few NZ men take paid parental leave - would offering them more to stay home help?
node.description: Opinion - New Zealand's capped parental leave payments seem to reinforce the stereotype of women as carers and men as earners outside the home, Claire Breen writes.

node.title: J.D. Vance lands Trump's endorsement for Ohio Senate GOP race
node.description: Vance is facing a crowded field in the Republican primary, including former Ohio GOP chair Jane Timken, former Ohio State Treasurer Josh Mandel and businessman Mike Gibbons.

node.title: NHL players' union staff cleared of wrongdoing in Kyle Beach sex assault allegation
node.description: A law firm concluded miscommunication and misunderstanding were behind the lack of action after Beach reported being assaulted by Aldrich, a video coach.

node.title: Major retailers accused of profiteering from rising inflation
node.description: Watchdog group Accountable.US notes that the nation's top 10 retailers have recently generated $99 billion in profit.

node.title: Birds killed by avian botulism spread through hot Auckland summer
node.description: The toxin is a water-bound disease that spreads faster in warm water ponds, and has infected thousands of birds this year.

node.title: Super Rugby Pacific: Crusaders vs Blues
node.description: Blues are taking home a win against Crusaders after a top of the table clash in Christchurch tonight.

node.title: War in Ukraine could harm global food supply, World Food Programme head says
node.description: Beasley said the conflict between Russia and Ukraine has caused a dramatic increase in the need for food aid around the world.

node.title: New device to make beach more accessible debuts in Nelson this weekend
node.description: A new device aimed to make a Nelson beach more accessible will debut this Easter.

node.title: More than 200 birds died at Illinois forest reserve from suspected bird flu
node.description: Though the virus is believed to pose a low risk to humans, farms across the country have had to kill millions of birds to stop the disease from spreading.

node.title: Toddlers ate goldfish crackers laced with THC, police say
node.description: Authorities say the children, who attended the same day care in Virginia, were hospitalized with symptoms of THC exposure.

node.title: New York town with crumbling sewage system receives $150M investment
node.description: The news comes months after the CBS Reports​ exposed Mount Vernon's crumbling sewage system.

node.title: Britain plans to send migrants to Rwanda under tougher asylum policy
node.description: Britain could send tens of thousands of asylum seekers to Rwanda, aiming to break people-smuggling networks and stem the flow of migrants across the Channel.

node.title: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," April 17, 2022
node.description: Senator Chris Coons, Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba and more appear on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" this Sunday.

node.title: California grocery workers ratify new contract, avoiding strike
node.description: Workers at Ralphs, Albertsons, Vons and Pavilions stores will get raises of $4.25 per hour and a say on safety issues.

node.title: Here's what Biden, Harris and their spouses paid in 2021 taxes
node.description: The first and second couples released their tax returns Friday.

node.title: Liz Sheridan, who played Seinfeld's mother on hit show, dead at 93
node.description: Sheridan was known for her roles in the television shows "Seinfeld" and "ALF."

node.title: Democrat Abby Finkenauer to remain on ballot for U.S. Senate in Iowa
node.description: Iowa's Supreme Court reversed a decision by a state district court to keep her off the ballot, due to three allegedly invalid signatures.

node.title: More than 900 civilian bodies found in Kyiv region, police say
node.description: Most of the civilians were fatally shot, Kyiv police said Friday, an indication that many were "simply executed."

node.title: Ukrainian mom watches daughter's burial on phone, 300 miles away
node.description: "She got out of the car and I went to follow. As I got out, I saw her fall. When I looked, her head was gone," Viktoria Kovalenko said.

node.title: Auckland Council facing fresh budget cuts as revenue falls $900m
node.description: A new round of budget cuts are on the cards as Auckland Council grapples with a $900 million fall in revenue due to Covid-19 and a blow out in transport costs.

node.title: Canceling student loan debt "still on the table" for Biden administration
node.description: The White House extended the federal student loan payment pause through August 31, but has not announced a decision about wiping out debt.
